Author: PorQuePanckes

Comment: “None” can be used as singular (it’s a pronoun meaning “not one”)  so whilst it may sound clunky, it is still correct to say “none is”. But yes, the plural is probably more commonly accepted.
Author: bigskymind

Comment: “None” is a pronoun meaning “not one” and therefore is singular but as mentioned above, the plural is more commonly used.
Author: bigskymind

Comment: It’s either depending on context. It can also mean “not any.”  [is none plural](https://www.latimes.com/socal/glendale-news-press/opinion/tn-gnp-0429-a-word-please-none-is-or-none-are-both-work-story.html)
